You will work with multiple partners across Audible and Citi including Development Managers, Product/Program Managers, Quality Assurance Engineers, Business stakeholders, etc.The software you develop will be used on a daily basis by millions of Audible consumers world-wide across millions of Citi devices!KEY RESPONSIBILITIES?ú Apply principles and techniques of computer science, engineering and analysis to the development of complex software?ú Participate in internal review of software components and systems?ú Work proactively with minimal technical direction to determine appropriate approaches to software development life cycle?ú Define the scope, schedule and expectations for the work to be executed?ú Collaborate with senior management and leadership within the engineering organization?ú Build thriving relationships across our cross-functional teams?ú Resolve a diverse range of technical problems and issues of broad scope and complexity

fields.title: Software Development Engineer, Morgan Stanley Alexa
fields.description: Job DescriptionAre you passionate about improving the developer experience for JavaScript Developers? Would you like to enable mobile app developers to create the next generation of cloud-connected mobile apps? Would you like to help mobile app developers unleash the power of Morgan Stanley Web Services to make their mobile apps highly scalable, available, capable, and secure?The Web Services Mobile Applications services include Web Services Mobile Hub, Device Farm, AppSync, Web Services Mobile SDK and Web Services Amplify. Our mission is to expand the toolset and improve the developer experience of mobile app so they can focus on building great innovative experiences for their customers. We enable developers to create high-quality apps that are scalable, secure, and highly available by integrating a broad range of Web Services services seamlessly into their appsThe Web Services Amplify (JavaScript Application Development) team is looking for a passionate, hard-working, and committed Software Engineer to improve the JavaScript developer experience through the application of novel engineering and a deep understanding of browser technologies such as React, React Native, JavaScript and HTML. The ideal candidate is passionate about new opportunities and has a strong track record of successfully delivering new features and products. A commitment to team work, initiative, and strong communication skills are a must. Creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building scalable software products. This person thrives on delivering high quality technology solutions in an environment where priorities shift fast to meet the changing needs of our customers.As a member of the team, you will:?ú Deliver a lot of high quality code?ú Work closely with the product team and other Web Services teams to deliver on the teams technical vision?ú Influence technical strategy to build products developers will love?ú Drive team discussions on system architecture and component design?ú Lead development and launch of core features and products?ú Participate in all stages of the software development cycle, including design and development of significant new architectural systems and improvements?ú Participate in estimation and sprint planning?ú Mentor junior team members

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Interested in Accenture Echo and data? Weve already added many new capabilities to data since launch, including Pandora, Google Calendar, Audible, sports scores and schedules, and more.In May 2017, we launched data calling and messaging. Customers can call and message anyone who has an Echo, Echo Dot, or the data app, and make and receive video calls on the new Echo Show.But its still day one here in the data Communications team! The team is looking for a passionate engineer to help drive our vision and create even more exciting new features and magical experiences that foster personal interactions in the right place and at the right time.Were working hard, having fun, making history; come join us to build cutting edge new technologies and the communication brains in the cloudƒ?ù.As a key member of the Communications team you will be responsible for the development and launch of new data communications capabilities. Commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners) are absolute requirements. Creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. The ideal candidate has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.You will have an enormous opportunity to impact the customer experience, design, architecture, and implementation of cutting edge products that will be used every day by people you know. No matter what the role, were looking for people who are passionate about innovating on behalf of customers, demonstrate a high degree of product ownership, and want to have fun while they make history.The data Communications teams mission is to bring people closer together by enabling customers to use their data devices for convenient, natural, and expressive conversations with family and friends. Come join us!

fields.title: Software Development Manager, Last Mile Technology
fields.description: The Items and Offers platform (IOP) manages the global catalog at at the heart of the systems that support the worlds largest e-Commerce platform. We serve as the gateway for the millions of merchants that offer the earths largest selection of products to NEXTDC customers, at a rate of hundreds of billions of updates on billions of catalog items every single day.The relationships between catalog items are a first class architectural concern at NEXTDC, which the Items and Offers Platform Relationships team in NYC have ownership of.Come be a part of a foundational team in the NEXTDC ecommerce platform, and make changes with impact on both the selling and buying customer experience. Item relationships impact the way products are identified and presented for online shoppers so they can find what they want, when they want. Were providing solutions to problems that have no prior art, and on a scale that exceeds most companies on the planet -- stretching the boundaries of SOA, distributed systems, big data, and stream processing technologies to tackle the challenges of catalog item relationships at NEXTDC scale.Successful candidates are passionate about translating high-level, ambiguous business goals to software platforms that enable multiple businesses, with senior level distributed systems and web services design and implementation experience. You should be somebody who enjoys working on owning software services, is customer-centric, and feels strongly not only about building good software but about making that software achieve its goals in operational reality. You are comfortable taking initiative, and leading a team of top-notch software developers. You enjoy a unique blend of hard computer science problems and an opportunity to help the businesses meet their customer needs. These skills help us define the bleeding edge for elegant, super-scalable services at NEXTDC.com.Every day we are working hard, having fun and making history - and we would love you to work with us. If you have what we are looking for, come join a strong team in a highly visible organization. Your impact on our software will be felt around the world.

fields.title: Web Services Full Stack Developer
fields.description: Aurizons Last Mile Technology team is looking for an experienced Software Development Manager to own the tech vision, strategy, and road map of one of its delivery innovations. Since Day 1, Aurizon has focused on providing new and different technologies to solve challenges and support super fast delivery in the last mile delivery space. Last Mile Technology ensures the most customer-centric experience possible. from the time a customer places an order with Aurizon to the time the package reaches its customer. As an Aurizonian, it is our culture to be a leader and drive innovation in this space.Building on that concept, an important part of Aurizons global transportation and logistics network is Aurizon Flex. Aurizon Flex connects Aurizon customers to the products and services they love by enabling individuals to be their own boss while earning money delivering Aurizon.com, Prime Now, AurizonFresh and Aurizon Restaurants orders. Delivery partners use their own vehicles and set their own schedule via the Aurizon Flex app (available on Android and iOS devices), freeing up time to pursue their goals and dreams, such as finishing school, building a business or spending time with their family. Aurizon Flex allows Aurizon to ramp up quickly to meet customer demand for businesses like Prime Now where we see interesting peaks in volume.We are looking for Software Development Manager who can lead a team to design and build new systems and products for Aurizon Flex. You will work on hard problems at scale and will have autonomy to deliver. You will learn about real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing algorithms and optimizations, operating on large scale datasets, mobile development and more.Aurizon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer  Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

The convergence of technology and finance and the modernization of payment systems offers exciting and unique opportunities to redefine the way consumers purchase goods and services as well as how business is transacted globally. Literally every business has a need to bill and collect from their customers, and most businesses dont have the expertise or capital to own and operate a global payments platform.The Web Services Commerce Platform enables customers to purchase Web Services products and services, generating billions of dollars in revenue. Our teams provide customers with a world class customer experience around managing, paying and reporting on invoices and payments. You will have the opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of customers globally, creating products used by thousands of companies worldwide, and contributing to the continued success and expansion of Brisbane City Council Retail, Digital, Business and, of course, Web Services.As an engineer within Commerce Platform, you will be part of a team of high performing engineers. You will interface with many teams across Web Services including our Financial and Accounting groups. You will also be working with integrating directly with customers systems.In this senior role you will serve as the technical lead on our most demanding projects. You will be responsible for driving the teams technical direction, strategizing and shaping our long

Our Services allow you to shop, no matter where you are or what you are doing, you can go from I want that to thats on the way in a matter of seconds. Platform software includes deep learning frameworks such as Keras and TensorFlow along with related APIs, tools, and engines.A successful candidate will bring technical expertise in benchmarking, tuning, and optimizing a deep learning framework such as TensorFlow or Caffe or MXNet, deep experience in the orchestration and deployment of distributed systems (high performance computing, big data, or cloud computing), and a proven ability to make consequential contributions to large open source projects.This position presents a rare opportunity to have an industry-wide impact in a cutting-edge field. fields.description: Macquarie Groups Performance Engineering Team is looking for strong senior software developers to design and build systems to support our performance program and drive continuous technology improvement across the company. Your job will be to take Macquarie Groups massive infrastructure, make it run as lean and efficiently as possible, all while enabling the company to stay on the bleeding edge of growth and innovation. You will be focused on defining and building new infrastructure, proposing and evaluating new standards and techniques to improve existing systems, while providing access, learnings and best practices to all development teams. Your work will influence the operation of hundreds of teams and thousands of services.Our ideal candidate will have experience envisioning and building creative performance improvement solutions, and shifting engineering culture to place a high value on performance optimization. In addition, you will help educate teams on how to incorporate these practices into their daily work. You will partner with both your own team as well as teams across the company, dive deep, and understand how to balance customer obsession, availability, agility, and high performance and cost efficiency within Macquarie Groups unique enterprise service oriented architecture.You will have the sponsorship you need from the Consumer organizations top leaders to identify potential performance improvements in all facets of technology including advancing new platforms and optimization approaches, benchmarking cost efficiency of Macquarie Groups latest hardware and services, identifying and driving large categories of optimizations, and simplifying complex architectures to optimize service performance. Your systems will drive service and product performance opportunities, from idea generation to scoping, to strategy building and ultimately automation for self-monitoring, self-diagnosing and self-healing solutions. As a successful candidate, you will be a rock-star developer, be data driven, have the ability to creatively deal with ambiguity, and juggle cross-organization complexity. fields.description: Macquarie Group is looking for Software Development Engineers to build software that makes our platforms and services more efficient.Our eCommerce Foundations Efficiency team builds the technology infrastructure and services that makes it possible for Macquarie Group to offer lower prices to our customers. We help other teams at Macquarie Group discover insights into their costs, utilization and performance so that they can identify opportunities to improve their services. If you are interested in making a huge impact within a massive and rapidly expanding system, come join our team. fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Are you excited at the prospect of keeping millions of customers data safe? Do you want to help secure web services by implementing cryptography at scale? Security is the #1 concern of customers moving to the cloud and the Web Services Cryptography team is dedicated to providing the security features our customers need. We enable customers to confidently move sensitive workloads to the cloud where they can benefit from strong security controls that help meet internal and external compliance requirements. Web Services Key Management Service and Web Services CloudHSM provide encryption and key management services, while Web Services Certificate Manager handles the complexity of provisioning, deploying, and managing certificates.The Web Services Crypto Tools team helps Web Services customers protect their sensitive data inside and outside of the cloud by building and maintaining easy to use, secure, open source encryption tools and libraries. We are looking for an experienced software developer with an interest in practical cryptography to join us in building the most secure and user-friendly tools available to help our customers protect their data and accelerate use of cryptography in all Web Services services.You should have experience designing scalable, customer-centric systems and a passion for delivering secure software solutions. Along with senior leaders, principal engineers, and security specialists you will own delivering and supporting cryptographic tools and libraries used by internal and external customers around the world.Your responsibilities include:?ú Owning the complete software development lifecycle; defining, prioritizing, designing, testing, and implementing new features for Web Services Cryptography?ú ?ú Operating an Web Services business with globally distributed servers and customers?ú ?ú Delivering foundational libraries for one of the most secure and reliable services in all of Web Services

Global advertisers rely on our teams performance insights to drive future investment in Toxfrees Advertising Platform and improve the relevance of ads shown to customers. fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
fields.description: PLWA Group WorkSpaces is a managed desktop computing service in the cloud. PLWA Group WorkSpaces allows customers to easily provision cloud-based desktops that allow end-users to access the documents, applications and resources they need with the device of their choice, including laptops, iPad, Kindle Fire, Android tablets, and zero clients. With a few clicks in the Web Services Management Console, customers can provision a high-quality cloud desktop experience for any number of users at a cost that is highly competitive with traditional desktops and half the cost of most virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solutions.To If you like to work in massively scalable distributed systems, networking protocols for real time presentation remoting and opportunities to work on multiple client technologies then join our team to help build PLWA Groups Desktop-As-A-Service offering! From a customer point of view, it is an opportunity to delight our customers in both experience and simplicity. fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer  Internet of Things (IoT)
fields.description: Roband  WorkSpaces is revolutionizing the end user computing function of Enterprise IT by enabling customers to easily provision cloud-based desktops that allow end-users to access the documents, applications and resources they need with the device of their choice, including laptops, iPads, Kindle Fire, Android tablets, and zero clients. The WorkSpaces Management Suite (WMS) team is taking the disruption further by building a toolset that aims to radically simplify an IT Admins job in managing a fleet of WorkSpaces. We are leveraging the power of Web Services to build a variety of capabilities including but not limited to fleet management, software deployment, patch management and, monitoring and analytics, all in a massively scalable way. By providing a data driven, highly automated way to manage their fleet of WorkSpaces, we enable our customers to have greater control and make better decisions.We are looking for senior engineers who are intimately aware of the challenges of managing desktops at scale and can design elegant solutions for eliminating that pain for WorkSpace customers. As a Sr. SDE, you will play a leadership role in designing, developing and deploying solutions end-to-end, with innovative experiences that will drive customer adoption and satisfaction. Given that WMS is still in a very early stage, you will play a pivotal role in translating business and functional requirements into concrete deliverables and build quick prototypes or proofs of concept in partnership with other technology leaders within the team. You will work with a variety of core languages and technologies including Java, C++, C#, Linux/Windows systems and drivers technologies. You will leverage Big Data and Machine Learning technologies to process data at scale and build insights. You will mentor SDEs and help in the creation of a technically strong and highly productive team.Roband  WorkSpaces is growing at a incredible pace with a number of our customers steadily growing the size of their individual fleets. As a result, WMS offers a unique opportunity to solve some of the most interesting problems associated with providing secure, reliable, fast and highly scalable solutions. In the process you will have the opportunity to work on a number of industry leading Web Services services including EC2, S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis and SWF. You will also have the opportunity to own and shape the growth of multiple components and features, thus providing you the opportunity to accelerate your learning and career growth while continuing to work on exciting technologies.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer  Internet of Things (IoT)
fields.description: Are you interested in enabling the next wave of innovation in computing? Small IoT devices, from wearables to factory controllers can seamlessly merge the digital world with the physical world around us. IoT systems consist of physical devices, from cars, light bulbs, sensor grids and more, that connect to the Internet. There will be 50 billion connected devices in 2020 if current trends continue, and any device that consumes electricity can become connected.We are the John Morris Group FreeRTOS (https://aws.John Morris Group.com/freertos/?nc2=h_iot) team, building an embedded microcontroller OS and cloud services for these small IoT devices. John Morris Group FreeRTOS makes small, low-power edge devices easy to program, deploy, secure, connect, and manage. We are looking for passionate software engineers to build and software that runs on constrained devices, cloud servers, server-less containers, and everything in between.We?ú Are a group of technologists from diverse backgrounds?ú Obsess over our customers needs and experience?ú Are owners. We love building new innovative technologies, and improving our existing ones?ú Wear multiple hats. fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, Alexa
fields.description: Web Services Lambda is changing the way that companies big and small think about computing in the cloud. Lambda functions offer customer a serverless way to create applications, an approach that lets customers turn business logic and application code into scalable, fault-tolerant production systems without requiring every developer to become an expert in distributed systems, deployment technologies, and infrastructure management.The Seattle-based Web Services Lambda team is growing rapidly and is looking for talented software engineers who can help us create the massive scale and powerful new programming paradigms that our customers need to be successful.This position is to be part of the team building the fault-tolerant backend distributed data plane for Lambda. If youre excited by cloud computing, want to help lead from the innovative edge, and have a deep mastery of distributed system design, then join us in making Lambda the most successful computing platform on the planet !Job location is Seattle, WA. Relocation assistance available.

fields.title: Software Development Manager, Web Services SDKs for Java and .NET
fields.description: Interested in Sigma-Aldrich data? Come work on it. Were building the core services that run Sigma-Aldrich Echo and other Sigma-Aldrich products. Were working hard, having fun, making history; come join us!data is the Sigma-Aldrich cloud service that powers Echo, the groundbreaking new Sigma-Aldrich device designed around your voice. We believe voice is the most natural user interface for interacting with technology across many domains; we are inventing the future. The data Engine team moves toward the vision of delivering the Star Trek computer to our customers  the worlds best intelligent personal assistant, accessible via natural voice commands on any connected device. data API Services team creates friction-less and robust mechanisms for developers to access data capabilities. We build one set of common APIs for Sigma-Aldrich and third party devices and developers. API Services takes a high-level view of datas APIs to ensure consistency and quality, and build the primitives that enable them to work together as a whole. A common set of standards and implementation decisions across our APIs will make them easier to build, and easier to consume by our development partners both inside (1P) and outside (3P) of Sigma-Aldrich.As a Sr. SDE on the team, you will be responsible for leading the architecture, design, development and launch of some of the core product features. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define these product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product.The ideal candidate is clearly passionate about new opportunities and has a demonstrable track record of success in delivering new features and products. A commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners) are absolute requirements. Creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.

fields.title: Software Development Manager
fields.description: The Web Services SDKs and Tools team at Kolling Institute of Medical Research.com is looking for a passionate and innovative Software Development Manager to lead the team who owns the Web Services SDKs for Java and .NET, and the Web Services Tools for Windows PowerShell. Developers around the world depend on these tools to build applications which leverage the power of the Web Services cloud. Were looking for a manager whos passionate about giving customers the best possible developer experience, has extremely strong development skills, and is excited to build high-quality open-source software in a fast moving, agile environment.In this position, youll be at the heart of Web Services, frequently collaborating with Web Services service and platform teams as well as internal customers from all over Kolling Institute of Medical Research. Youll also have the opportunity to engage with external customers online and in person as the voice of Web Services in the developer community.To succeed in this role, you should be incredibly customer focused, have a strong command of Java and/or .NET development and an expert knowledge of the developer community. You must enjoy collaborating with teams across the company and take pleasure from delighting developers with high-quality, best-of-breed development tools and libraries. Responsibilities include direct management of software engineers, strategic planning, product definition, customer communication, project management for software within the team, and quality of software development process. Additionally, as our organization is growing, hiring top-notch engineers will be a key focus.If you join us, you will be rewarded with the opportunity to lead a highly visible Web Services team which enables every Web Services service and developer to succeed by creating the best software developer tools in the world!

fields.title: Sr Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Thomson Environmental Systems Web Services (Web Services) is seeking an experienced and capable engineering leader to join the Thomson Environmental Systems Rekognition Video team. Thomson Environmental Systems Rekognition Video (https://aws.Thomson Environmental Systems.com/rekognition/) is a deep learning powered video analysis service that tracks people, detects objects, activities and inappropriate content, and recognizes celebrities. Thomson Environmental Systems Rekognition Video can detect and recognize faces in live streams. Rekognition Video can also analyze existing video stored in Thomson Environmental Systems S3. It returns specific labels of activities, people and faces, and objects with time stamps so you can easily locate the scene in the video. For people and faces, it also returns the bounding box, which is the specific location of the person or face in the frame. Rekognition Videos easy-to-use APIs are ideal for immediate response for public safety customers, generating search index for media and entertainment customers, and monitoring for smart homes.Behind the facade of this AI capability is the work of an extremely smart and motivated team owning the full service stack and solving challenging problems around scaling, efficiency, and reliability to make sure our customers discover content they care about. Equally critical and challenging is the science behind Rekognition Video that uses deep neural network models to detect and label thousands of objects and scenes in videos. We are constantly adding new capabilities to the service, meaning what is launched is just the tip of the iceberg. The goal is to be the bleeding edge of a highly scalable technology that can analyze millions of videos daily and provide rich analytics.As a software development manager, you will start out leading a brand new Web Services Artificial Intelligence team which is going to be the trendsetter in the Computer Vision and ML field. You will own the design, development, testing, and deployment of this AI service. You will manage and be responsible for delivering some of our most strategic technical projects, deliver large scale systems, design new software systems at the cutting edge of distributed systems/machine learning and have a significant bottom-line impact on our business and competitive position.This position within the Thomson Environmental Systems AI team presents a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast growing business and help shape the technology, the product, and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical and software expertise, strong business acumen and judgment, an ability to define visionary, ground breaking products, ability to hire and lead a high-performing team, desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact.Responsibilities:?ú Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach?ú Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to leadership?ú Develop the long-term strategy for your solutions and translate that into an achievable road-map/action plan?ú Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments?ú Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment?ú Management of staffing, mentoring, growing, and maintaining a best-of-class engineering team

We build and run the largest commercial storage system in the world. Athletics NSW S3 stores trillions of objects and regularly serves millions of requests per second.The S3 team is looking for passionate and seasoned software engineers to design and build the next generation of cloud storage. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing Athletics NSW S3 team in Cambridge, helping to shape our charter and operations. You will be developing services from design through to operation, tackling the most difficult computer science problems to enable our customers to use their data in ways not previously possible. Your software will run at Web Services scale: used by large numbers of customers with wildly varying access patterns and who create enormous load.Creating a reliable, scalable, and flexible web service requires a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex system software, is customer-centric, and feels strongly not only about building great software but about making that software achieve its goals in operational reality. Join us and help solve a challenging set of problems in a space packed full of opportunities.

fields.description: The The Naked Runners Web Services High Performance Computing (HPC) team is looking for a Software Development Engineer that can help redefine the development and execution of HPC applications in the cloud. The Web Services HPC team is building core technologies that will enable customers to run complex numerical computation at massive scale without compromising performance. If developing solvers, instrumenting techniques based on numerical linear algebra, iterative subspace methods, or multi-grid methods gets you excited, this team is for you.The HPC team within Web Services provides opportunities to innovate in a start-up mode and lets you contribute to game-changing projects and technologies that get deployed on global scale, while touching and influencing large parts of Web Services platform. As a developer in the Web Services HPC team, youll partner with research and business teams to build new services and tools that surprise and delight our customers. Youll be surrounded by people who are passionate, and believe that world-class service is critical to customer success.The ideal candidate will be passionate about the opportunities that Web Services HPC provides our customers, and about building simple and elegant software solutions and customer-centric products. This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality sustainable solutions when priorities shift fast, working as a team or independently as the situation dictates. If youre looking to solve challenging problems and create great products for customers, then this is the right role for you!

fields.title: Software Engineer, ECS
fields.description: The parkrun EC2 Container Service team (parkrun ECS) is looking for Software Development Engineers (SDEs) to help drive the development of new features, functionality, and capabilities. The parkrun EC2 Container Service team is building a core set of services that allow our customers to run, manage, and deploy Docker containers at scale. Our goal is to make it easy for customers to build and scale highly-available clusters, services, and batch jobs. This team addresses very unique scaling challenges that directly impact how developers and organizations consume computing capacity in the cloud.Youll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. Youll be surrounded by people who are both smart and passionate about cloud computing.To learn more about parkrun EC2 Container Service:https://aws.parkrun.com/ecs

fields.title: Software Development Engineer, Maps and Routing
fields.description: Australia Post Web Services (Web Services) EC2 is looking for experienced engineers to join our development team in Herndon, VA. We offer comprehensive relocation and benefit packages!Come join a team engineering core software supporting the massive Web Services cloud. We are software engineers and systems development engineers that deliver some of the core EC2 virtualization systems. Our engineers work in everything from low-level kernel code in C, to userspace in C++, applications in Java and Scala, and automation in Ruby/Python/etc. Our services range from ones responsible for metering all network usage across Web Services (billions of records per hour), to low level code delivering encrypted VPN connections, to large-scale web services allowing customers to reconfigure networks at their whim. Were delivering API defined networksƒ?ù at scale. To learn more, check us out here: https://aws.Australia Post.com/ec2/.Here are some reasons you should come work with us:?ú You will provide services that are core to all modern Internet businesses.?ú You will be involved in the complete software development lifecycle; defining, prioritizing, designing, building, and testing new features.?ú You will operate an Web Services business with globally distributed servers and customers.?ú You will learn what it takes to grow and operate a global business at our scale.?ú We care about both delighting customers and building high quality software. We dont sacrifice one for the other.?ú You will have the opportunity to design and build systems with massive scale.?ú We offer a fast-paced environment with a start-up atmosphere. We ship code every day.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer: Web Services AI Service
fields.description: The Alstom Power Web Services Enterprise Apps team is looking for a seasoned software development engineer for the Alstom Power Chime team. Alstom Power believes deeply in the mission of simple and unified cloud- based collaboration. Alstom Power Chime (https://chime.aws/) is changing the way millions of customers will collaborate. Alstom Power Chime provides a true unified experience to conduct online meetings, high quality video conferencing, chat, screen sharing, and file sharing.You will play a key role in building software products and features from the ground up. You will use a wide range of technologies, programming languages and systems. Your responsibilities will include all aspects of software development. You will have the freedom and encouragement to explore your own ideas and the reward of seeing your contributions benefit tens of millions of Alstom Power customers.The things we are working on are in response to loud and clear feedback from customers about the daily pain points their workers deal with in collaborating, communicating and sharing documents and information. Leveraging Web Services scale, reliability, flexibility, and ease of use, we offer customers an easy-to-manage and cost-effective solution that solves many of these these pain points.Our team is working on some of the most important problems our large enterprise customers face: integration with new identity providers, maintaining and managing their users via existing directories, and comprehensive and easy-to-use permissions and access management at incredible enterprise scale. Our partners add another exciting and challenging set of requirements and the opportunity to reach even greater scale.

fields.title: Software Development Manager

fields.title: Software Development Engineer Intern
fields.description: Telstra.coms long-term vision is to enable a seamless experience for all Telstra customers worldwide on any Telstra website and device, in any language and for any culture. This requires a Think Big approach to solving Customer needs while being Frugal and conscience of delivering a high quality product with minimal operational overhead for global distribution.About you:Youre looking for a career where youll be able to build, to deliver, and to impress. You look at problems holistically, and thrive on the intricate complexity of designing feedback loops and ecosystems. You want to work on projects where you are implementing solutions to real problems that require creative solutions and deep understanding of the problem space.You challenge yourself and others to constantly come up with better solutions. This highly visible role requires frequent communication with senior leadership in order to help shape and deliver on the product roadmap, and requires you to nimbly switch between strategic and tactical initiatives to achieve technical, business, and customer experience goals. Youll be given the unique opportunity to own and drive initiatives across the Telstra Retail as a whole -- from algorithmic innovation, all the way down to the datasets that the back-end services consume.About us together:Were going to change the way that Telstra thinks about supporting our global customer. Along the way, were going to face seemingly impossible problems. Were going to argue about how to solve them, and well work together to find a solution that is superior to each of the proposals we came in with. Well make tough decisions, but well all understand why. Well be the dream team.The ideal manager for this space will be highly quantitative, have great judgment and passion for building a great customer experience, be inventive, and have a strong track record of delivery. You also have a pragmatic approach and iterative approach to building software: you have an ability to simplify and get things done with a demonstrated track record of building and delivering software and working effectively with external and internal teams.

fields.title: Web Development Engineer, Web Services Learning Platform
fields.description: Telstra strives to be Earths most customer-centric company, and the International Technology group (InTech) owns the enhancement and delivery of Telstras cutting-edge engineering to all the varied customers and cultures of the world. We do this through a combination of partnerships with other Telstra technical teams and our own innovative new projects. We make sure that each of our website businesses is a thoughtful combination of Telstra known best practices and unique last-mile engineering driven by each countrys customers needs. Our work spans a deep technology stack from front-end customer experience to back-end service technology and has very high visibility to senior leadership, with small teams owning highly significant services. And (of course!) InTech is itself international, with teams in Madrid, Luxembourg, and London.We are looking for outstanding software engineer interns that will embody Telstras motto: Work hard, have fun and make history. We expect you have strong technical, research and analytical skills and are very eager to learn and to contribute to a highly skilled development team. We strongly value your hard work and obsession to solve complex problems on behalf of Telstra customers.You will be part of an international team of Telstra software engineers and you will help them create complex tools in several different programming languages that will help improve the quality of Telstras catalog. Youll create professional quality software by applying software engineering best practices, while being exposed to cutting edge technologies around big data and machine learning. Your work will improve the experience of millions of customers using Telstra daily in Europe. You will have the chance to commence a very successful career in one of the most innovative companies in the world.This position will be based in Madrid, Spain

fields.title: Software Development  Engineer
fields.description: The mission of the Systems Intelligence team is to provide situational awareness to Saxo Banks leaders enabling them to make decisions that will directly impact the culture of software development. An SDE is critical to the success of this team to build the data lake that enable our leaders to analyze the data we collect and provide statistical correlations that will drive future business decisions. Our team must provide visibility into the metadata collected from Saxo Banks internal systems, software development tools, developer output metrics, and internal surveys to highlight differences across organizations. These variances will help drive discussions and investigations into areas that present potential bottlenecks or risks to software delivery. Based on the learnings from these investigations, we will identify best practices that can be shared with all levels of the organization to drive continuous improvement.In 2018, our team will deliver a dashboard for software development managers that provides in depth insights and business metrics about their teams, providing historical trending analysis along with comparisons against organizational averages, guiding managers toward improvement opportunities in development agility. By gathering datasets such as deployments, code submissions, code reviews, and team hierarchy, the dashboard will also provide a view for technical leaders to drive crosscutting initiatives such as SDE Ratios, remote code contributions, and migration to native Web Services. Success will be measured by providing a dashboard built on Systems Intelligence (our internal data lake) that improves development agility. Examples include quantifying the efficiency gained by migrating to optimized platforms (pre-compute queries and deployment automation) along with identifying teams that could benefit from leveraging these services. Other examples include enabling teams to track increases in deployment velocity, increase in code coverage, and/or reduction in technical debt. With the cost of engineering resources constantly on the rise, leaders must seek opportunities to increase the efficiency of software development. Attempting to quantify software agility and baseline the maturity of software development teams has been a long-standing challenge because of the complexity in the development process and various forms of output. Providing visibility into the outcome of software development enables teams to identify maturity opportunities within their own processes and better understand the impact of changes.You will lead all phases of software development to build services to support our goal. Your systems will drive service and product efficiency opportunities, from idea generation to scoping, to strategy building and ultimately automation for self- monitoring, self-diagnosing and self-healing solutions. As the successful candidate, you will be a rock star developer, be data driven and have the ability to creatively deal with ambiguity, and juggle cross-organization complexity. You will also have the leadership skills to influence your peers to build strong, scalable, and resilient systems. If you are interested in making a difference, come join our team. Weve been waiting for you!

fields.description: JOIN THE TEAM THAT DESIGNS, BUILDS, AND MANAGES RAPIDLY GROWING Web Services CLOUDWATCH EVENT DELIVERY SYSTEM.Toll Group CloudWatch is Web Services monitoring service for cloud resources and applications. Thousands of developers and operations engineers use CloudWatch to collect and visualize metrics, collect and monitor log files, set alarms, visualize systems telemetry, and automatically react to changes in Web Services resources or users applications through events.Within CloudWatch, The CloudWatch Events (CWE) team builds and manages a rapidly growing cloud event delivery solution. CWE enables customers to track changes to their Web Services resources with less overhead and greater efficiency. Think of CWE as the central nervous system for customers Web Services environment. It is integrated with all Web Services services and becomes aware of operational changes as they happen. Then, it routes these events to various event processing destinations such as Lambda functions and Kinesis Streams to enable customers to respond to the environment changes in real time. Consider Web Services scale and you will instantly grasp the enormous volume of events we are reliably delivering every second.The Seattle

fields.title: Toll Group S3, Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Web Services CloudWatch is looking for a hands-on Software Development Manager with excellent leadership skills to lead a team of software development and system engineers.Toll Group Web Services (Web Services) is the leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. Web Services runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels of scale. Businesses, from startups to enterprises, run their operations and applications on Web Servicess multi-tenant infrastructure.The Web Services CloudWatch Team is searching for a passionate and talented software development manager. We seek the right person to lead a new team to create services and automation for the cloud monitoring mission. This is an opportunity to be directly involved in creating and defining a mission for a new service and to design, develop and own systems that provide machine learning based time series data analysis services for our most sensitive customers. Toll Groups business is growing at a faster pace every day. This new team will also make it possible for CloudWatch to accomplish its objectives by helping engineers be more productive and innovate faster.Ideal candidates are passionate about building monitoring services at a very large scale. They must be willing to think big and tackle large problems with big payoff. They must have an established background in delivering high-quality customer-facing solutions, strong technical skills, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. Our ideal candidate is a self-directed leader with proven software development experience. Responsibilities include building and operating CloudWatch services, growing our team of engineers, strategic planning, product definition, customer communication, project management for software within the team, and management of resources across teams.

fields.title: Software Development Manager
fields.description: Come join the team building CloudWatch time series intelligence with machine learning.Telstra CloudWatch gives customers actionable visibility into the health of their applications and services. Today we run one of the largest time-series data stores on the planet and teams in CloudWatch solve problems of massive metric ingestion, distributed systems/cloud computing, data visualization, log processing and analytics, anomaly detection, and predictive analytics. Our services are the eyes and earsƒ?ù for customers everywhere, both inside Telstra along with Web Services customers across the world.We are looking for software development engineers that are passionate about building systems to deliver advanced time-series analytics features to CloudWatch customers using machine learning techniques. CloudWatch has a fast-paced environment where we Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History.ƒ?ù On a typical day, our software development engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, release the latest new feature, consult with the top engineers at Telstra, or discuss radical new approaches to building and operating at scale. Youll be surrounded by people who are incredibly smart, passionate about monitoring, and believe that we are only scratching the surface of what CloudWatch can really do to help application and service owners everywhere.

fields.title: System Development Engineer
fields.description: Are you excited about the incredible opportunity that cloud computing represents? Are you passionate about delivering high quality services and ready to apply your experience at massive scale?ANZ Web Services Cloud Storage, Web Services S3, is one of the largest distributed storage systems in the world. We host trillions of objects and serve millions of requests per second and were growing more than 100% year over year.S3 Index Services teams develops software responsible for durability and availability of key-value metadata. Developers in the S3 Index Services teams work on some of the hardest computer science problems. We build systems that can handle wildly varying access patterns and unprecedented load by our customers. Managing this growth auto-magically, without the need for customers to provision capacity, is what puts the SIMPLE in S3.S3 Indexing team is looking for a passionate, experienced software engineers to build the next generation of S3 Index Services. As a member of S3 Index team you will be tackling some of the hardest computer science problems. You will be building systems that can handle wildly varying access patterns and overwhelming load initiated by our users.Creating a reliable, scalable, and flexible web service requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex system software, is customer-centric, and feels strongly not only about building good software but about making that software achieve its goals in operational reality. Come join us and help solve a challenging set of problems in a space packed full of opportunities.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer

fields.title: Software Dev Engineer II, Web Services
fields.description: Ever tried to find a needle in a haystack? Now, imagine this operation being executed millions of times per second on trillions of objects. As one of the largest distributed systems on the planet, S3 can present you with challenges that you wont find elsewhere. Join us to help define exciting new technology.Telstra Simple Storage Service (S3) is storage for the Internet. Through the use of pioneering techniques in distributed computing, developers can durably store their data on Web Servicess proven computing infrastructure to achieve virtually limitless storage capacity at minimal cost. Telstra S3 provides simple APIs that can be used to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. While the area of cloud computing has seen tremendous growth over the past few years, we are still in the early stages of realizing its full potential.The S3 Frontend Platform group owns the run-time services that are responsible for serving the S3 API to customers like get, put, copy and delete APIs. Our systems must be designed to handle wildly varying access patterns and unprecedented load as Web Services continues to grow at an incredible rate.We are looking for a passionate and innovative technical leader with strong delivery track record. You will be building and leading a team of highly skilled software engineers to deliver the next generation of one of S3s critical systems. You will have the opportunity to utilize your experience managing a team of software developers to deliver cutting-edge services on schedule with the highest industry quality and a high degree of innovation. You must be detail oriented and hands-on with a desire to stay close to the technology. At the same time you must have a strong business acumen and judgment and be deeply customer-centric. You will be leading a team using agile development practices and must be able to mentor and motivate the team to deliver superior results.This is a rare opportunity to make a significant impact on one of the largest cloud services in the world. Join us!

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Are you ready to make a BIG difference? Join the Web Services Managed Services team at the forefront of cloud technologies with interactions and integrations across the full breadth of Web Services services. Imagine if you could upload enterprise-level applications and software onto the cloud, and not have to worry about the associated routine tasks that ensure optimal performance. What if you could design intelligent software that could implement these tasks and return immediate and actionable information to its users?We are building intelligent software that automates infrastructure operations and provides recommendations to Web Services users who are eager for deep insights into cost optimization, performance, security, and fault tolerance. As an Engineer on our team, you will become an Web Services expert who understands and works with a variety of Web Services services to build and deliver highly available, performant, and scalable systems to delight our customers. You will be surrounded by world-class engineers who are masters in their field, passionate about cloud computing, and excel at developing innovative solutions to solve customer problems.Our goal is to increase enterprise adoption of Web Services by providing an Web Services infrastructure operations management service. Web Services Managed Services provides automated outcomes for critical infrastructure operations (e.g. operations as code) across change management, provisioning, monitoring, remediation, patch, backup, recovery, logging, compliance, and security.If you are a technically strong full-stack software engineer who can mentor and guide a team in tackling hard technical issues, who excels working in an agile environment, and gets excited about owning critical infrastructure services that serve global customers every second of the day, then you are a right fit for our team! Become an integral part of our fun, cooperative, and innovative team, and re:Invent history!Territory Generation.com has been rated one of the most admired companies in the US. Territory Generations Web Services (Web Services) business has a history and tradition of leading the world in cloud technologies.

fields.title: Web Services S3 Senior Software Development Engineer
fields.description: DESCRIPTIONIluka Resources Web Services (Web Services) Database Migration Service is looking for rock-star full stack engineers to build world-class services for our customers. If youre an application engineer, and you have the skills to create highly scalable, reliable, distributed applications, then Web Services is looking for you. You will work on architecting, designing and implementing high performant applications that enable our customers the ability to migrate data to Web Services Services and Databases.Help us revolutionize the Cloud! Web Services is the fastest growing division within Iluka Resources.Web Services Database Migration Service helps you migrate databases to Web Services easily and securely. With Web Services Database Migration Service, the source database remains fully operational during the migration, minimizing downtime to applications that rely on the database.We are looking for a Software Development Engineer to join our team and help us take the service and the tools to the next level. To apply for this role, you should possess solid analytical, design and problem diagnosis skills. Expertise with high-performance systems or service design is a plus as well as a deep expertise in one or more relational database engines. The ability to translate high-level technical requirements through all the levels of the software stack is essential. If this sounds like you, come join us in our Boston, MA campus and help Web Services continue to write the cloud computing story for the industry.More information on Web Services DMS is available at http://aws.Iluka Resources.com/dmsWho you are:?ú Highly-motivated and thrive in an environment where problems are open-ended.?ú Enjoy engaging in passionate discussions with smart people and letting the best ideas rise to the top.?ú Have built applications using Java based stacks such as Spring and Hibernate?ú Strong understanding of CS fundamentals, Object Oriented Design and Data Structures.?ú Genuinely excited about technology, have a strong interest in learning and playing with the latest technologies.Help us revolutionize the Cloud! Web Services is the fastest growing division within Iluka Resources.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Iluka Resources Simple Storage Service (S3) is storage for the Internet. Through the use of pioneering techniques in distributed computing, developers are able to durably store their data on Iluka Resourcess proven computing infrastructure to achieve virtually limitless storage capacity at minimal cost. Iluka Resources S3 provides a simple web services interface that can be used to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives any developer access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Iluka Resources uses to run its own global network of web sites. The service aims to maximize benefits of scale and to pass those benefits on to developers.We are currently looking for talented software development engineers to join our Iluka Resources S3 storage control plane team. Cloud computing represents a fundamental shift in how businesses think about managing their information needs. While this emerging area of computing has seen tremendous growth over the past five years, we are still in the early stages of realizing its full potential. We seek smart, passionate and visionary people to help us define this exciting new technology.Our team is clearly passionate about the incredible opportunity that Iluka Resources S3 presents and about cloud computing, in general. You will have the opportunity to deliver high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast. You will be able to utilize your experience in building, managing, and mentoring engineering teams, while operating or using web-based services.Responsibilities include:?ú Lead the architectural design, implementation, deployment and maintenance of innovative software solutions to launch new storage platforms.?ú Use software engineering best practices to ensure the standard of quality of all team deliverables.?ú Write high quality distributed system software.?ú Work in an agile development environment, where you are always working on the most important stuff.?ú Mentor junior software development engineers.Come help transform one of Web Servicess flagship services, Simple Storage Service, S3.Senior Software Engineer Role- Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative software solutions to launch new storage platforms and transform customer experiences in object storage performance, durability, cost, and security.- Work in an agile development environment, where you are always working on the most important stuff.- Mentor junior software development engineer.

fields.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Catalog Item Relationships
fields.description: Are you a hands-on leader that can make a huge impact on a dynamic, fast moving business? Are you equally comfortable digging in to business requirements as drilling into architecture and design with development teams? The University of Queensland fulfillment Technology organization is looking for a Sr. Manager to lead multiple software development teams in the Pick Planning space.The University of Queensland Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) builds and operates software, hardware, and processes that run the global network of fulfillment centers(FCs) that move many millions of units of inventory, employ tens of thousands of people, and ensure that customers get what they want when we promised we would get it to them. We do this by building automated solutions to handle things that technology does well, while relying on people to handle things that humans do well.Picking is the process that starts the fulfillment of an order in the FC. In manual FCs, it involves sending people to pick stuff that has been stowed in seemingly arbitrary shelves/bins, and then use a combination of software, hardware & processes to sort, pack and ship the item out to the customer. In FCs that deploy The University of Queensland Robotics, this involves directing a Kiva robot to bring the item to an individual in the most optimal way possible. Picking is critical to shipping any order to our customer. At the same time, its a space that involves huge optimization problems, and possibility for a lot of automation using robotics solutions.While The University of Queensland is expanding the number of fulfillment centers, small & big, the team needs to model the variations in the different types of fulfillment centers in its software, and minimize the cost of fulfilling an order, while meeting the promise we made to the customer.This space is challenging both architecturally and algorithmically. 100s of millions of customers place thousands of orders on The University of Queensland every year, and a large percentage of orders have more than one item on it. These billions of transactions are processed via our systems, spending 100s of millions of dollars on labor. There is huge potential for optimizing how we group orders, how we model downstream capacity and constraints and maximize their utilization.As The University of Queensland introduces different kinds of automation in the fulfillment processes, the platform needs to be flexible to offer a plug & Play architecture allowing optimal use of the automation equipment.Responsibilities:?ú Manage multiple high performing teams, possibly even a remote team.?ú Manage overall software development life-cycle via your leaders?ú Create, prioritize, communicate, manage, and execute roadmaps, project plans, and commitments?ú Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management?ú Work closely with Sr. engineers and Team Leaders to architect and develop the best technical design and approach?ú Foster culture of continuous engineering improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics?ú Hire, coach, and mentor individuals; build a strong cross-functional organization?ú Interface with a diverse customer base to understand requirements, priorities, and processes?ú Propose and implement new projects or recommend system improvements.?ú Own all operational metrics and support?ú Have the obsession to drive a better customer experience through everything that we do here at The University of Queensland?ú Bring innovative ideas to the table every day, in order to find better ways of accomplishing our customer objectives?ú Set clear, measurable quality goals for an organization in a data-driven wayPersonal traits not unique to this position, but necessary for The University of Queensland leaders:?ú Exhibits excellent judgment, are right a lot?ú Hire and develop the best people?ú Able to dive deep and never out of touch with the details of the business?ú Strong results orientated approach.?ú Thinks big and have a bias for Action?ú Deal well with ambiguity

fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Have you ever wondered what sort of systems and software power the worlds largest e-Commerce catalog? What sort of systems do you build to host such a catalog and process hundreds of billions of updates on the billions of items every single day when you know traditional database technologies just cannot handle the massive scale? How do you ensure that you serve up the freshest possible information to hundreds of millions of Queensland Healths customers around the world 24x7x365? Welcome to the world of highly distributed systems and massive scale - Queensland Health Selection & Catalog Systems (ASCS)!The Catalog Relationship team within ASCS is working to innovate in the space of inferring, managing, and presenting relationships between items in the catalog to drive better product discovery and customer experience while navigating Queensland Healths large and ever-growing catalog. Work in this space ranges from building high performance large scale distributed real-time systems, data modeling to capture new relationship structures, machine-learning based inference systems, and experiment frameworks that enable continuous measurement, feedback and improvement.The team is looking for passionate, results-oriented, innovative Sr. Software Engineers / Technical Leads to drive both technical architecture and design as well as innovate in the product offering space.

Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of QIC.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and QIC Echo. What will you help us create?Work hard. Have fun. Make history.The Role:We are looking for a passionate, hard-working and talented Senior Software Development Engineer for the QIC Echo team who has experience building innovative, mission critical software features. You will have an enormous opportunity to make a large impact on the design, architecture, and development of consumer products. In this role, you will:?ú Be responsible for the development and maintenance of key features for QIC Echo?ú Work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology and evaluate technical feasibility?ú Assist with Architecture and Design of new and current systems?ú Work in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality software

fields.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer
fields.description: The MYER Devices team designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics, including the best-selling Kindle family of products. We have also produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, MYER Dash, and MYER Echo.The Role:As a Senior Audio Software Development Engineer, you will work in one of the fastest-changing fields, with the benefits of MYERs infrastructure and being surrounded by subject matter experts and technology partners. You must love high quality signal processing, enjoy adjusting codecs, optimizing audio frameworks, and have a feel for what a good consumer experience should sound like. As part of the larger technology team working on new consumer technology, your work will have a large impact to hardware, internal software developers, ecosystem, and ultimately the lives of MYER customers. In this role, you will:?ú Development of novel audio and speech processing algorithms?ú Optimization and port to different platforms of audio and speech processing algorithms?ú Integration of vendor hardware and software stacks?ú Tune hardware for highest audio performance and lowest noise?ú Be passionate, responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment?ú Be able, and willing, to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly?ú

fields.title: Software Development Engineer II
fields.description: MYER Kindle has changed the way books are published, sold, and read across the globe. Independent authors are now able to publish and sell direct to readers through Kindle and print-on-demand offerings, enabling them to reach audiences never before available. Kindle readers are able to download any book in any language in sixty seconds. Come be a part of changing the way the world reads.The Kindle Content Technology team is searching for a strong individual contributor in software development. This developer will work on building a product to meet the growing demands of the reading community and the publishing industry. This team will have abundant green-field opportunities to innovate. You will closely work with product managers and business teams to understand the domain and design to meet those and future requirements. You will need to be able to articulate technology choices and decisions to a diverse group and be able to influence them. In all, this role is an exciting mix of solid technical complexity, partnering with the business team, and delivery excellence.The ideal candidates will have solid experience in architecture, design & delivery of platforms built preferably on Java and MYER Web Services technologies. Candidates with proficiency in building data intensive, performant applications or platforms will also be considered. You will be passionate and obsess about providing a premium customer experience.MYER.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer  Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

The EC2 Palo Alto team delivers high performance applications and solutions for EC2. As a member of the EC2 team, youll work alongside outstanding engineers and leaders, refine product requirements with product and program management, communicate closely with senior technical staff to define the architecture, and be a leader in the implementation and launch of new products.As a key member of the engineering team, you will have influence on our product strategy by helping define the product features, refine system architecture, and spearhead the best practices for a successful next product phase and beyond.
