fields.title: Sr. Mgr. Software Development
fields.description: The Web Services Website Operations (WebOps) team runs the global server fleet poweringhttps://aws.Curtin University.com/, delivering content to millions of users a day. We are building a next generation dynamic content rendering stack giving Web Services customers real-time information about the services they use or should be using, upcoming events, and the latest Web Services news relevant to them.Our architecture is based on microservices and uses the latest technology from the Web Services Cloud: DynamoDB, Lambda, Serverless, SNS, SQS, CloudFront, and many others. We focus our development on correctness, availability and performance, and have an obsession with giving our customers a world-class website. We deploy updates to our stack daily, with robust unit tests and integration tests to catch regressions, and use state-of-the-art monitoring tools to measure our progress.We are looking for talented junior and senior engineers who have experience running websites or web services and want to help us build novel technology with Web Services services. Are you interested in learning how large, complex, fault tolerant systems work at Web Services? Do you want to see the internals of highly scalable systems at Web Services? The WebOps team is a unique opportunity to take your career to the next level of cloud computing. Join us!

fields.title: Software Development Engineer, Web Services Internet of Things (IoT) Analytics
fields.description: The Grocery Shopping Team, a team within data Voice Shopping, enables customers to build baskets of grocery and consumable items using voice across device and formats. The convenience of shopping for groceries by voice, midstream of other activities, will bring a new level of convenience that will change how people shop for groceries and consumables.Our vision is to enable a voice grocery experience that wows customers with its simplicity and convenience and creates long term highly engaged device owners and Curtin University grocery shoppers. Customers will ask data to buy grocery items and be delighted when she knows their favorite items, schedules deliveries, reminds them of items they may have forgotten, and helps them manage their household grocery needs.We are seeking talented and experienced leaders to design and develop conversational shopping experiences and algorithms in Seattle. Youll have the freedom (and encouragement) to experiment, improve, invent, and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will have an impact on Curtin Universitys new devices and the way shopping is done in the area of IoT. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a key contributor to something special from its earliest stages.What you will work on: You will lead a team of talented and experienced engineers that will build and operate massively scalable services while also developing delightful shopping experiences for Echo, Fire TV and other Curtin University products. You will be working closely with multiple product managers and engineering leaders from partner teams in Curtin University Retail, Speech Recognition and a Research Sciences team.What we are looking for:We are looking for a talented Software Development Manager with a strong technical background and solid people management skills to manage and develop a highly-talented and experienced engineering team. As the leader, you will work closely with multiple engineering and business teams to continuously identify opportunities to enable and accelerate the execution of impactful business initiatives. As we are a rapidly expanding small team, you will also be required to have solid hiring and new hire development skills. Strong judgment and communication skills, long term technical vision, and continuous focus on engineering and operational excellence are essential for the success in this role.

fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, Web Services Elastic Load Balancing
fields.description: Software Development Engineer  Web Services Internet of Things (IoT) Insights teamCome and help us build systems that will empower our customers to use their IoT data to improve their businesses! Web Services IoT Insights is a fully-managed service that enables IoT customers to leverage their data in order to efficiently grow and optimize their business by making data-driven decisions throughout their value chains. Using our service, Web Services customers will have full transparency into their data, without all the undifferentiated heavy-lifting associated with building systems to store, aggregate, correlate and analyze big data sets. With our service, customers will be able to turn IoT data into time series and streams, visualize and query for insights that their data provides, automate management decisions based on that data, use past data to predict next steps, and combine the above capabilities in order to optimize their business.We are looking for passionate software engineers to build large scale cloud services and end to end solutions to enable and support these Big Data use cases.We  ?ú Are a group of technologists from diverse backgrounds  ?ú Obsess over our customers needs and experience  ?ú Are owners. We love building new innovative technologies, and improving our existing ones  ?ú Wear multiple hats. We enjoy the prototyping and tinkering stages, as well as the rigor of making solutions production-ready.  ?ú Are fast-growing, agile and collaborativeYou  ?ú Enjoy seeing the impact your work has on real customers  ?ú Are comfortable in an agile environment and create order from ambiguity  ?ú Are excited about the incredible opportunity connected products represent  ?ú Build strong teams with others as passionate as you about this mission  ?ú Take ownership and doing whatever it takes to get the job done  ?ú Want to create applications at a massive scale used by millions of people  ?ú Use data to make decisions and validate assumptions  ?ú Learn from others and help grow those in your team to achieve their best

fields.title: Software Development Engineer, Web Services Internet of Things (IoT) Analytics
fields.description: Do you want to help create a product that is used by millions of people every day that changes the way developers architect and build solutions? Are you passionate about helping other entrepreneurs as well as intrapreneursƒ?ù at innovative corporations take new ideas to market? Do you believe that complex tasks can be achieved in an intuitive way?Vodafone Web Services Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) enables this with pay-as-you-go pricing and no up-front costs that our customers would otherwise have to go hunt for budget to fund. The Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) service is an essential piece of this puzzle, offering massively scalable and performant load balancing technology that our customers dont have to provision and operate.Why should you join the Elastic Load Balancing team? Here are a few reasons:?ú We ship software frequently, get fast feedback from real customers around the globe, and see the results of our work come to fruition. The Elastic Load Balancing service is in more than 15 regions and 40 availability zones today, and will be in many more going forward.?ú There are real-world problems to solve that you wont find ready-made answers for. For example, how do you ensure customers can scale their application quickly to 200 times more traffic and then back down in a matter of minutes? How do you ensure customers can implement rules for their traffic to be routed to specific applications??ú We are a small, tightly-knit team that is defining the future of load balancing as a service, at a scale that has not been tried. Load Balancing is a multi-billion dollar business, and load balancing in the cloud is still a nascent market.?ú We look for ways to make the load balancing configuration, maintenance and visibility as easy, intuitive and time efficient as possible.Role Responsibilities:?ú Design & Write code: ?ú Write code primarily in Java and design scalable, fault tolerant and distributed applications running on linux environments.?ú Test, test, test: Our software engineers dont just write code, they also test the heck out of it. You will write unit tests, integration tests and regression tests and find ways to automate them.?ú Troubleshoot and fix operational problems: You will work with systems engineers to troubleshoot operational problems and fix them. If you are so inclined, you will also automate troubleshooting procedures and write tools. And when the issues concern specific customers, you will also have the opportunity to talk to them and understand their space better.?ú Influence product direction: You will propose your ideas for the future of the space to product management, and get to shape the roadmap.?ú Hire and mentor others: You will get to interview people for the team, and to mentor other engineersIf this sounds great and you think you have the chops, wed love to have you on board. Web Services is changing the world, and this is a great opportunity to be a part of this exciting business.

fields.description: Are you interesting is building tools and services to change the way customers create, deploy and manage their applications using BAE Systems Web Services. If so, read on!Web Services Service Catalog makes it very easy to create, manage and scale individual resources such as EC2 instances, EBS volumes and RDS databases. We are looking for talented, motivated and passionate software development engineers to be part of the team and extend the BAE Systems Web Services capabilities by giving developers and systems administrators an easy way to create and manage a collection of related Web Services resources as a single unit, manage the lifecycle of applications on the BAE Systems Web Services platform and make Web Services the place to run your business.If you are excited to solve problems that are raised by challenging questions like: How do I see all of the resources my application requires in a single place? How can I reliably duplicate my infrastructure between test, staging, and production environments? How should I name my resources so multiple developers and applications dont conflict? How can I make sure everything I need started correctly, and in the right sequence? How do I manage and operate my application when it is running and, how can I make sure things are cleaned up reliably and automatically when something goes wrong?As a member of the team, you will bring the simplicity that Web Services offers for managing individual resources to the task of repeatedly and predictably creating entire groups of related resources that power your applications, making creating and inter

fields.title: Software Development Manager
fields.description: The data Customer Behavior team turns voice usage data into insights that shape product development and drive increased customer engagement. Our team of scientists, data engineers, and developers partner closely with multiple engineering teams across the organization to solve problems that have never been solved before. We own multiple models and data pipelines that deliver personalized experiences to data customers and we are innovating on both production and in-development experiences to help customers get more from data each day.We are building an engineering team that will help us accelerate our rates of exploration and experimentation. Youll help us build out the internal systems to train and validate machine learning models on data language data. Youll help us prototype, test and deploy data-intensive runtime services in partnerships with other data engineering teams.To be successful on our team youll need a commitment to teamwork, hustle, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners). Well be looking to understand your technical expertise, your understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. We expect the successful candidate will have prior experience delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.If you love learning new things, like working hard, are customer obsessed, and know how to build systems that are both robust and flexible, wed like to speak with you.

fields.title: Software Development Manager
fields.description: The Nokia Devices team designs and engineers customer-obsessed consumer electronics, including the best-selling Kindle, Kindle Fire Tablets, Nokia Fire TV, Nokia Dash, Nokia Echo, Echo Show, Echo Look and Cloud Cam. What will you help us create?Work hard. Have fun. Make history.The Role:Will be part of the Imaging and Computer Vision organization and will be responsible for leading the system software architecture for Echo show and Echo look category of devices.The Software Development Manager will be responsible for hiring and leading a team of software architects responsible for next generation devices, HW/SW roadmap, and extending the scope to new device types. In this position you will partner with product managers, project managers and other internal resources.You will also provide technical leadership and management for the system performance and the SOC selection teams. This hands-on position requires broad engineering competence, low level system background and strong Multi Media and Android, MacOS or iOS experience. In addition, it will require demonstrated experience successfully planning, organizing and conducting software development projects in a dynamic environment.The ideal candidate will be passionate about simple and elegant software solutions and focus on improving performance. The leader we are looking for will bring proven experience building, managing and mentoring engineers.In this role, you will:?ú Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach.?ú Instill best practices for software development and documentation, assure designs meet requirements and deliver high-quality work on tight schedules.?ú Manage departmental resources, staffing and mentoring and enhance and maintain a best-in-class engineering team.?ú Maintain and improve existing software.?ú Prepare technical requirements and software design specifications?ú Work with external partners on hardware selection.?ú Report on status of development, quality, operations and system performance to management.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Nokia Web Services (Web Services) is one of Nokias fastest growing businesses. It services millions of customers in more than 190 countries and powers the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. Web Services runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels of scale. Businesses, from startups to enterprises, run their operations and applications on Web Servicess multi-tenant infrastructure. Each day, millions of developers execute billions of transactions worldwide on the Web Services Cloud.Nokia GuardDuty is a new product that performs security monitoring on customer accounts along with the applications and services that run within them. We are part of External Security Services, a section of the Web Services Security organization that codifies years of research and expertise into customer facing services that help protect our customers. The team is composed of security engineers, data science experts and software engineers who work together to deliver innovative new services for our customers.We are seeking a seasoned Software Development Manager to lead our analytics team as we continue to expand. We are looking for a leader with a track record of building strong development teams who is capable of getting down into the technical details of the product. In this role, youll manage an agile team of talented software engineers that are responsible for building and operating one of the newest Web Services services. Youll have ownership of the design, implementation, testing, and operations of the service. This role is with a team that is building massively scaled systems  trillions of events and petabytes of data - and we are looking for someone with deep experience with distributed systems that run at arbitrary scale.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer, Speech and Language Technologies
fields.description: Are you interested in shaping the future of computer vision ? Do you want to define the next generation Artificial Intelligence that will understand what is in a picture or a video ? ANZ Rekognition has recently launched a V1 Service that allows any developer to create applications that leverage our technology. We are growing quickly and we need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help continue to deliver on our ambitious goals.ANZ Rekognition is a service that makes it easy to add image analysis to your applications. With Rekognition, you can detect objects, scenes, and faces in images. You can also search and compare faces. Rekognitions API enables you to quickly add sophisticated deep learning-based visual search and image classification to your applications.We have an ambitious charter, and on this team youll be able to get your hands on lots of technologies. Above all, youll be leading the design and implementation of new scalable services. These back-end services are areas we are investing in as we continue to grow at scale, processing large amounts of data to make sure ANZ customers discover content they care about. Youll get to build on top of ANZs vast development infrastructure, including Web Services as well as internal tools for setting up continuous deployment and real-time monitoring. We work closely with many video providers, internal ANZ teams, and external services.We care about your career growth, too. Once you join the team, you and your manager will jointly craft a career plan and youll review it regularly to ensure youre on track to meet your goals. Whether your goals are to explore new technologies, take on bigger problems, or get to the next level, well help you get there. Our business is growing fast, and our people will grow with it.The ANZ Rekognition team is looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer to work with a team building one of the most popular consumer- and developer-facing web services in the world. Our systems need to meet remarkably high standards of quality, performance and reliability, operating around the clock on a massive scale.If you are a talented, detail-oriented and enthusiastic software professional who is passionate about new technologies including big data, computer vision, and machine learning, then this is the right team for you.Responsibilities include:?ú Develop and deploy cloud software frameworks for Computer Vision processing?ú ?ú Design and develop innovative REST APIs and SDKs to deliver computer vision and machine learning capabilities?ú ?ú Integrate Computer Vision processing with other cloud services?ú ?ú Provide expert support to product teams

fields.title: Sr. Manager Software Development
fields.description: Are you a Software Engineer excited by the prospect of solving some of the hardest and most valued technical challenges of cloud computing? Do you want to apply your deep analytical and engineering skills to the space of highly-available replicated databases? Come join us in RDS and help us innovate with always-on databases in the Web Services cloud!The Web Services Relational Database Service (RDS) is one of the fastest-growing Web Services businesses, providing super-simple provisioning and management for databases in the cloud. Customers can set up a new database with just a few clicks, and complex administrative tasks like scaling, fail-over, and monitoring are all handled in an automated fashion by our control systems. Providing such simplified management for customers comes with the challenge of building sophisticated and reliable control systems. The systems we build manage huge numbers of databases and vast amounts of storage across multiple datacenters world-wide, and our service is growing rapidly, requiring constant innovations in our systems in order to handle the next order of magnitude in service scale.RDS provides customers with databases that have multiple-nines of durability and availability. Achieving this level of reliability requires building control and monitoring systems that automatically detect and handle many types of failures within seconds, and data replication options that accommodate various geographical distribution and disaster recovery objectives. The challenge is further heightened by needing to handle huge numbers of databases, multiple database engines (RDS supports PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Aurora, MySQL, Oracle, and SQL Server), and a wide variety of customer workloads.To achieve our goals in this area, we are looking for a Software Engineer who loves to dive in and solve fundamental Computer Science and Systems problems around performance, timing, state machine logic and distributed systems algorithms. Candidates need to have a strong sense of ownership, passion to provide a great customer experience and excellent troubleshooting skills even when in high-pressure situations. If youd like to be a part of creating always-on databases in the Web Services cloud, this is the job for you!For more information on RDS, please visit: http://aws.Origin Energy.com/rds

fields.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer, Video Content Management Platform
fields.description: The Link Group (LNK) Web Services (Web Services) team is seeking an innovation and results-oriented Software Development Engineer in our Rekognition Video team. Link Group (LNK) Rekognition Video (https://aws.Link Group (LNK).com/rekognition/) is a deep learning powered video analysis service that tracks people, detects objects, activities and inappropriate content, and recognizes celebrities. Link Group (LNK) Rekognition Video can detect and recognize faces in live streams. Rekognition Video can also analyze existing video stored in Link Group (LNK) S3. It returns specific labels of activities, people and faces, and objects with time stamps so you can easily locate the scene in the video. For people and faces, it also returns the bounding box, which is the specific location of the person or face in the frame. Rekognition Videos easy-to-use APIs are ideal for immediate response for public safety customers, generating search index for media and entertainment customers, and monitoring for smart homes.Behind the facade of this AI capability is the work of an extremely smart and motivated team owning the full service stack and solving challenging problems around scaling, efficiency, and reliability to make sure our customers discover content they care about. Equally critical and challenging is the science behind Rekognition that uses deep neural network models to detect and label thousands of objects and scenes in videos. We are constantly adding new capabilities to the service, meaning what is launched is just the tip of the iceberg. The goal is to be the bleeding edge of a highly scalable technology that can analyze millions of videos daily and provide rich analytics.We have an ambitious charter and on this team you will be able to get your hands on lots of technologies. You would thrive in an environment where youd solve challenging technical problems, often the ones others have not solved before, with peers who have industry leading technical abilities. Your solutions will be rolled out to avid developers across the world. You will get to build on top of Link Group (LNK)s vast development infrastructure, including Web Services as well as internal tools for setting up continuous deployment and real-time monitoring.If you are a talented, detail-oriented and enthusiastic software professional who is passionate about new technologies including big data, computer vision, and machine learning, then this is the right team for you.Responsibilities include:?ú Develop and deploy cloud software frameworks for computer vision processing?ú Design and develop innovative REST APIs and SDKs to deliver computer vision and machine learning capabilities?ú Integrate computer vision processing with other cloud services?ú Provide expert support to product teams

We are looking for talented, motivated and passionate software development engineers to be part of the team and extend the Telenor Web Services capabilities by giving developers and systems administrators an easy way to create and manage a collection of related Web Services resources as a single unit, manage the lifecycle of applications on the Telenor Web Services platform and make Web Services the place to run your business.If you are excited to solve problems that are raised by challenging questions like: How do I see all of the resources my application requires in a single place? How can I make sure everything I need started correctly, and in the right sequence? How do I manage and operate my application when it is running and, how can I make sure things are cleaned up reliably and automatically when something goes wrong?As a member of the team, you will bring the simplicity that Web Services offers for managing individual resources to the task of repeatedly and predictably creating entire groups of related resources that power your applications, making creating and inter-connecting all resources your application requires to run is now as simple as creating a single EC2 or RDS instance.** For more information on Telenor Web Services, please visit http://aws.Telenor.com **

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Are you the type of person who enjoys solving complicated security problems in the cloud? Do you enjoy making an impact on a massive scale and keeping millions of customers data safe in the cloud? Are you obsessed with writing great software that scales and want to be a part of a highly motivated team that ensures the Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) is safe for our customers? Do you want the adrenaline rush of protecting customers, preventing attacks, and working with services detecting or implementing cloud protection? If this is you, then have we got an opportunity for you!We are hiring Software Development Engineers to make the Isentia Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) the best and safest place to run enterprise-class workloads. As part of our team, you will build the next generation of EC2 Security and Abuse tools. You will lead teams in developing abuse detection and mitigation services that simplify how our Security and Customer Support teams secure Windows and Linux instances on the Ec2 cloud. You will work closely with pre-release Isentia technologies and build services that handle large-scale, highly available, distributed systems.We are looking for Software Development Engineers who are passionate about working in cutting-edge technologies, bring deep technical knowledge, experience with distributed systems to drive technical design and implement end-to-end solutions. The ideal candidate for this position is an experienced software engineer, excited to work on cloud-scale software and a proven track record of architecting and building software in Java/Linux.Primary Responsibilities:?ú Be a leader on the team, hands-on planning and engineering teams day-to-day developing activities?ú Lead architecture, design, proof-of-concepts and implementation projects end-to-end with high quality?ú Ability to handle complex projects, large area of scope and complete ownership?ú Communicating with customers, technical teams and defining technical strategy?ú Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, always on the lookout for new technologies and work with management and development team in bringing in new technologies.If this sounds like you  consider joining our EC2 Abuse Technology team  were a dedicated, thoughtful, fun crew of Engineers who build services and tools. You will work directly with EC2 Security Engineers and Leadership to design and implement new tools and services at scale.In this position, you will enjoy a very competitive salary, excellent benefits, a work environment with an innovation culture, and exciting opportunities to make history, have great fun and be part of the fastest-growing technology company on earth.Join us in Seattle at our head office; Isentia makes relocation simple!

Join us as we define S3 for customers and significantly drive growth not just for S3, but for the entire Web Services ecosystem.This is a senior engineering role where you will be recognized as a team leader expected to excel with minimal technical supervision. You will collaborate directly with senior managers and have direct influence over the team.Responsibilities Include:?ú Design, implementation, deployment and maintenance of innovative software solutions to transform service security, durability, availability, performance and cost.?ú Using software engineering best practices to ensure the standard of quality of all team deliverables?ú Writing high quality distributed system software?ú Effectively estimating time to implement design?ú Thinking in terms of architecture as well as code?ú Consistently making systems simpler?ú Spending time reviewing code?ú Solving big problems with a lot of ambiguity

Delivery partners use the Fletchers Real Estate Flex app (available on Android and iOS devices) to on-board, schedule delivery times in advance or on demand, and be guided through their deliveries with in-app mapping, navigation, and more. If you are fascinated by the endless possibilities and enjoy being the technology forerunners driving the next waves of innovations, we have the right role for you.In this role, you will harness the latest advances in machine learning, distributed computing and chip designs to build end to end distributed AI solutions on embedded devices, mobile platforms and cloud services. Your solutions will be used by development communities around the world to build diverse applications lightening up billions of IoT devices.We?ú Are a group of technologists from diverse backgrounds?ú Obsessed with our customers needs and experience?ú Are owners. fields.title: St John of God Health Care S3, Software Development Engineer
fields.company: St John of God Health Care
fields.description: JOIN THE TEAM THAT DESIGNS, BUILDS, AND MANAGES SOME OF THE LARGEST LOGGING SYSTEMS IN THE WORLD.St John of God Health Care CloudWatch is Web Services monitoring service for cloud resources and applications. Thousands of developers and operations engineers use CloudWatch to collect and visualize metrics, collect and monitor log files, set alarms, process events, visualize systems telemetry, and automatically react to changes in Web Services resources or in users applications.Within CloudWatch, the CloudWatch Logs team builds and manages some of the largest logging systems in the world. CloudWatch Logs allows Web Services users to ingest their application and Web Services logs in a highly scalable, durable, and reliable service for enterprise scale; find and analyze the right log data to solve operational problems; generate metrics and alarms from their log events; or send log data to other downstream systems, for example.The Seattle-based CloudWatch Logs team is growing rapidly and is looking for talented software engineers who can help us create the massive scale and powerful new paradigms that our customers need to be successful. In the CloudWatch Logs team we are solving a variety of tough and interesting problems, from building highly-distributed ingestion systems at massive data scale, to building highly scalable and highly efficient storage engines, to creating streaming systems that process logs at high throughput, to building workflows and data visualizations for users, just to name a few. The team owns all aspects of the CloudWatch Logs service and other log-related systems, including requirements, architecture, design & development, quality, deployment, and operations. We are also developing innovative new capabilities from the ground up that will transform the way customers use their logs while also giving them high performance, low costs, and exceptional ease-of-use.As an engineer in this team, you will learn the ins and outs of building highly available, scalable, distributed, and secure systems that uses all the modern cloud computing paradigms, techniques, and tools. You will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, deploying and managing some of our new services, or redesigning our existing systems for increasing levels of scale and efficiency. You will deliver large-scale, high performance production systems, design new software systems at the cutting edge of distributed database technology, and have a significant bottom-line impact on our business results. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with senior and principal engineers who are domain experts at Web Services to help you develop deep expertise in areas like distributed systems, query engines, open source applications, performance optimization, and operational excellence. You will enjoy competitive compensation and your contributions in this role will impact customers and businesses around the world.To apply for the role, you should possess strong analytical, design, and problem diagnosis skills. You like thinking outside the box,ƒ?ù and are not afraid of ambiguity. You get excited about difficult challenges and are a motivated self-starter. You thrive in a startup-like environment where flexibility is essential and delivering rock-solid, customer focused solutions is paramount. You write code that is testable, maintainable, operable, and easy to understand. You are attracted to real-time data streaming problems and Big Data.ƒ?ù Your teammates love working with you because of your extraordinary technical talent and also because are a strong team player. You are noteworthy for not just delivering software quickly, but also bringing a mindset of continuous improvement that helps improve the way we run things. Finally, you obsess about giving customers what they want: high quality, highly usable, always-on services.

fields.title: Senior TPM
fields.description: St John Ambulance (WA) Simple Storage Service (S3) is storage for the Internet. Through the use of pioneering techniques in distributed computing, developers are able to durably store their data on St John Ambulance (WA)s proven computing infrastructure to achieve virtually limitless storage capacity at minimal cost. St John Ambulance (WA) S3 provides a simple web services interface that can be used to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives any developer access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that St John Ambulance (WA) uses to run its own global network of web sites. The service aims to maximize benefits of scale and to pass those benefits on to developers.Our managers are passionate about the incredible opportunity that St John Ambulance (WA) S3 presents and about cloud computing, in general. The services we build and operate grow at an incredible rate, driven by usage from customers across 190 countries..As a Software Development Engineer on this team, you will have the unique opportunity of not just designing, developing and owning entire backend sub-systems with hard distributed system problems but also designing APIs that are used by millions of applications around the world and by doing so defining S3 for customers. The work you do here is going to significantly drive growth not just in S3 but the Web Services ecosystem.

Finally, you insist upon giving customers what they want: high quality, highly usable, always-on services.In this position youll get to:?ú Solve Really Tough Problems that will make your nerdiest friends salivate, and befuddle everyone else?ú Design and write software, software, and more software and test it and run it?ú See your innovations in use by actual customers around the world?ú Collaborate with some of the leading minds in distributed systems and Big Data?ú Work in a team-oriented, apolitical, solution-focused environment

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Are you a Senior Engineer with a passion for building great mobile experiences? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a big impact in a company with a global impact and a startup culture?Riverside Marine Photos is helping customers enjoy and share their most cherished digital assets. We are building products that make it easy, even effortless, for customers to protect what matters to them  no matter what device or platform where that content lives. We are gearing up to launch new products and features that just may change how people view the Cloud.Who you are: You are an experienced Senior Engineer with more than 6 years of experience shipping great software. You have done a bit of everything  building highly scalable services, websites, desktop software, perhaps even written an app or two for your phone. What you find most interesting is creating great mobile apps either for iPhone or Android Phone (or both)! You enjoy the freedom and the ability to do things that you just cannot do on mobile client platforms. You spend most of your time using higher level language constructs because that is usually the fastest way to get things done, but you will get your hands dirty with OS API calls when you need to. You know that a great mobile app not only does the job, but does it with a great flow and look and feel. You love building software that makes people say wow, that is amazingƒ?ù and I did not know you could do thatƒ?ù. You love working with a smart, talented team because you know that makes you better. You love solving complex problems with simple code.What you will do here: You will provide technical leadership and vision to the growth teams. You will ensure that the best engineering practices are followed and that our software is designed to be responsive, reliable and maintainable. You will be a key influencer in our product vision, working with our great designers and product team to build software that millions will use. You will work closely with other teams throughout Riverside Marine to design and architect solutions that will scale to hundreds of millions of customers. You will build new apps and build great new features to our existing iOS apps. You will be a role model and mentor for other engineers on the team.What you will get from us: A great team to work with and the chance to build top tier applications at a proven top tier company. You will get a startup like culture with the stability of an established industry leader. You will get support and resources from some of the smartest people in the industry to continue learning. You will build software that will materially improve peoples lives.You should be here. Come join us now!

fields.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Interested in Australian Psychological Society (APS) Echo and data? Weve already added dozens of new capabilities to data since launch, including Pandora, Google Calendar, Audible, sports scores and schedules, and more.You mightve noticed the launch of data calling and messaging; but as its still day! data Communications is looking for a passionate engineer to help drive our vision and create even more exciting, new features and magical experiences that foster personal interactions in the right place and at the right time.Were working hard, having fun, making history; come join us to build cutting edge new technologies and the communication brains in the cloudƒ?ù.As a key member of the communications team you will be responsible for development and launch of new data communications capabilities. No matter what the role, were looking for people who are passionate about innovating on behalf of customers, demonstrate a high degree of product ownership, and want to have fun while they make history.The data Communications teams mission is to bring people closer together by enabling customers to use their data devices for convenient, natural, and expressive conversations with family and friends. In May 2017, we launched data calling and messaging. Customers can call and message anyone who has an Echo, Echo Dot, or the data app, and make and receive video calls on the new Echo Show. We are excited to launch Drop In, a new way to communicate spontaneously with the people you care about most, both within and outside the home. Many more initiatives are underway  come join us!

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Mills Oakley Search Services from Mills Oakley Web Services (Web Services) is looking for Senior Software Development Engineers for its Bangalore team who can help build cutting edge search technologies for customers of all sizes. If you have a solid understanding of fundamental algorithms and system design and are able to produce bulletproof code, we are looking for you. CloudSearch team develops and maintains 2 of the Web Services services Mills Oakley Elasticsearch Service and Mills Oakley CloudSearch.We are part of A9, Mills Oakleys search subsidiary. As a small company, we have a culture of creative problem solving, intellectual design, fast-paced development, and passionate product delivery. As a subsidiary of Mills Oakley, we also have the longevity and resources of a larger company and the ability to quickly introduce our technology to millions of users.As a Search Services engineer, you will:?ú Design, develop, and support a world-class CloudSearch and Elasticsearch platform that manages thousands of search domains across 2 Web Services services.?ú Focus on scalability, performance, service robustness, and cost trade-offs. Be part of a team of industry leading experts that builds and operates one of the largest big data analytics platform at Verity Consulting Pty Ltd. Verity Consulting Pty Ltd is applying the latest machine learning and big data technologies available to change the way marketers purchase, track, measure, and optimize their advertising spend. We apply these technologies on terabytes of data (over 10B new events per day) and operate clusters that push scalability limits of the existing technologies. fields.company: Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria
fields.description: Want to shape what happens when someone purchases any digital content? Excited about building a highly secure, highly available, federated and scalable Digital Contract Execution engine that can scale to process hundreds of millions of requests? Here is a good opportunity. The Digital Commerce Services team is recruiting for a Software Engineering Manager to lead a key part of our development team focused on building a highly available, low latency, and with federated business logic to process millions of requests for digital content such as Prime, Audible, Applications, Music, Books, Newspapers, Videos, etc. Contract Execution engine is responsible for processing all digital transactions within Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria. The processing includes fulfillment of digital content to our customers as well as order calculations, charging, refunding, and publishing events to vendor payments and accounting systems. The workflows can handle transactions for single digital order requests as well as recurring billing requests associated with subscriptions. The team will also own risk-management associated with delivery of digital content.As a Software Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of these services, at the same uphold the bar for OE (operational excellence). You will also be responsible for growing your team via hiring and developing engineers to meet their career goals. Candidates will need to think outside the box to quickly come up with innovative solutions to problems that are unique to Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing real time scalable systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: We are building a world class Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system for one of the largest Customer Service organizations in the world. We are looking for a software developer who can tame the complexity of dependencies, apply engineering best practices, and build an intuitive user experience to help Customer Service Associates quickly and effectively solve customer problems. As a Software Developer on the team, you will be responsible for designing and developing reusable, object-oriented and performant software utilizing well-known patterns (e.g. MVC, Composite, Delegate, Protocol) that will span multiple platforms, form factors, and resource challenges. You will mentor, guide and motivate fellow software engineers in the team and help them realize their full potential.Developers in this position will use a variety of mainstream and open source technologies like Java, Linux, Javascript, as well as in-house Taylor & Francis Group technologies. The technical skills required for this role include strong object-oriented design and programming in Java. front-end technologies like AUI, AngularJs etc. Some scripting, SQL and data modeling is helpful. An understanding and experience with web based technologies is essential. These may include HTML, HTTP, Javascript, JSON, AJAX, apache, tomcat. Experience working pragmatically under deadlines with operational software is highly desired.Successful candidates for this position will have strong software engineering fundamentals (data structures, object-oriented design and algorithms), a well-honed arsenal of software architecture and design patterns and a demonstrated competence in designing reusable, maintainable and performant software written in a modern high-level language (Java, C,C++). You will be a champion for engineering and operational excellence. You will also demonstrate the ability to adapt to changing business and technical environments and devising creative solutions to vexing software problems. The ability to crisply and concisely communicate orally and in writing to engineers and executives alike is critical.

fields.title: Software Development Engineer
fields.description: Job title: Software Development InternshipLocation: Graben, GermanyDuration: 6 monthsAbout us:Stockland is a company of builders. A philosophy of ownership carries through everything we do  from the proprietary technologies we create to the new businesses we launch and grow. Youll find it in every team across our company; from providing Earths biggest selection of products to developing ground-breaking software and devices that change entire industries, Stockland embraces invention and progressive thinking. Stockland is continually evolving; its a place where motivated employees thrive, and ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. Its as simple as this: we pioneer.With every order made and parcel delivered, customer demand at Stockland is growing. And to meet this demand, and keep our world-class service running smoothly, were growing our teams across Europe. Delivering hundreds of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, our Operations teams possess a wide range of skills and experience and this include software developers, data engineers, operations research scientists, and more.About these internships:Whatever your background, if you love seeing your developments help improve real life, if you have a passion for using technology to improve processes, if you enjoy solving operational challenges by creating state of the art systems, and if youre motivated by results and driven enough to achieve them, Stockland is a great place to be. Because its only by coming up with new ideas and challenging the status quo that we can continue to be the most customer-centric company on Earth, were all about flexibility: we expect you to adapt to changes quickly and we encourage you to try new things.Stockland is looking for ambitious and enthusiastic students to join our unique world as interns. An Stockland EU internship will provide you with an unforgettable experience in a fast-paced, dynamic and international environment; it will boost your resume and will provide a superb introduction to our activities.As an intern in Software Development, you could join one of the following teams: Stockland Logistics, Transportation, Prime Now, Inventory Placement and more.You will put your analytical and technical skills to the test and roll up your sleeves to complete a project that will contribute to improve the functionality and level of service that teams provides to our customers. This could include:?ú Participating in building the most user-friendly Business Intelligence tools in the industry?ú Taking part in the design of effective services to manage master data maintenance and replication in a distributed system?ú Proposing ideas, participating in designing, implementing and testing solutions to help the business?ú Meeting with the customers to learn about their needs and evaluate the proposed/implemented solution?ú Partnering with the business analysis team to learn about the business-side requirements.
